oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Spirit of the Farm
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Advertising; Farming; Fruit; Vegetables; Bees; Horses; Corn; Agricultural machinery & implements; Fencing; Swine; Poultry
Agriculture
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Variety of advertisements geared towards farmers. Farming equipment and products are advertised, including plows, seeds, plants, and more.

"The Spirit of the Farm," a weekly journal devoted to agriculture and livestock, was published in Nashville from 1883 to 1886. The editor was B. M. Hord. This journal is a typical Progressive-era farm publication.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Spirit of the Farm Publishing Company
